column1: What is the maximum number of reduce moves that can be taken by a bottom-up parser for a grammar with no epsilon- and unit-production (i.e., of type A -> ? and A -> a) to parse a string with n tokens?

column2: It is the position in a sentential form where the next shift or reduce operation will occur
column3: It is non-terminal whose production will be used for reduction in the next step
column4: It is a production that may be used for reduction in a future step along with a position in the sentential form where the next shift or reduce operation will occur
column5: It is the production p that will be used for reduction in the next step along with a position in the sentential form where the right hand side of the production may be found
